title: Discussions related to the September 6, 2023 Washington Post Article

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On September 6, 2023, the Washington Post published an article at the following URL:

https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2023/09/06/cdc-rsv-vaccine-guidelines/

This article contains a few key statements that lack individual attribution. Namely, the one I'm interested in:
"The virus is primarily spread via respiratory droplets when a person coughs or sneezes, or through direct contact with a contaminated surface."

This does not specifically occur anywhere in public CDC materials. The issue of droplet spread of airborne diseases is at the very center of current controversy in public policy, because it's at the core of an ongoing worldwide scientific paradigm shift in the field of infectious diseases and bioaerosols.

I am seeking, in the general sense, copies of discussions, emails, and records, mostly external, but also internal deliberations, regarding this article.

In the specific sense, in addition to the aforementioned records, I am seeking the discussions with reporters that contain the phrase and/or typographical variations of the phrase "The virus is primarily spread via respiratory droplets when a person coughs or sneezes, or through direct contact with a contaminated surface", but also, any documents/records that are used to support that claim, and any related discussions of formulating that claim as presented to the press.

Given this primarily involves copies of direct correspondence with members of the public, I do not expect complete redactions under the deliberative process principle.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ALEXANDER RICCIO

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

In April of 2023, three unfounded calls reporting an active shooter on the University of Pittsburgh’s Oakland campus prompted a massive police response. News reports say University and city police responded to the campus at about 11:15 p.m on April 10th after police received three calls stating a shooter was in the Hillman Library on Forbes Avenue. In one call, the sound of gunshots was heard in the background, Pitt Police Chief Jim Loftus told reporters. 

I am looking for the audio of these calls as well as any after action reports, incident reports, investigative reports, call detail logs and body camera footage of officers responding to this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra
